did.unittitle: Richard Doddridge Blackmore, Teddington, to "My dear Sir"

scopecontent.p: acknowledging receipt of his beautiful book and expressing appreciation of the recipient's warm approval of his own works. He discusses writing literature and mentions his own work on "a little skit of fiction." He feels that the recipient's "gift is for longer & higher flights of imagination." Included is an advertisement for Lorna Doone

did.unittitle: Richard Doddridge Blackmore, Teddington, to "My dear Augustus,"

scopecontent.p: inviting him to spend a fortnight of his holidays with the Blackmores, provided it is approved by his father
